comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: These are the Curtiss JN-3 airplanes of the U.S. Army's First Aero Squadron, which flew from a newly-established base at Columbus, NM following Villa's raid, to Pershing's headquarters at Casas Grandes, Chihuahua, Mexico on March 19 and 20, 1916. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1st_Reconnaissance_Squadron#Punitiv... According the Wikipedia account, these planes proved unsuitable due to the altitude and heat conditions, and were returned to Columbus by April, 1916.
